data.title: Completely redone over the past few years.
data.text: Old Hess building is being restored and looks great. Many local high end food and beverage places. Movie Theater within walking distance. Several different types of food available with average to above average prices.

data.title: A different square
data.text: I have lived in Springfield most of my life. The square has changed over the yrs. Time and again. It's now sadly frequented with homeless. They hang out and makes it a little scary to sit in.Now all the businesses near are some pretty good eats.But skip the square.

data.title: Not for older folks, thank you
data.text: This is the center of downtown Springfield, which has absolutely been taken over by the college crowd in the evening/night.  If this is you and you like to party, this is where you want to be, Dude.

data.title: Dangerous area
data.text: This area has gone down hill so much, it is very frequented by college kids and other who look for trouble. I would not take my kids to this area at all.

data.title: Scary
data.text: After millions of dollars the square remains somewhat less than good.  Too many street people without a purpose, poor selections of merchants, and little attention to improving the atmosphere.  Few variety of stores.  Has turned out to be more of a college crowd hangout

data.title: Historical town square
data.text: Springfield has one of the nicest town squares for a larger city. It is has a small-town feeling. There are concerts, fairs, shoot-outs, etc there during the spring and summer. I believe this is where there was a shoot-out between Wild Bill Hickok and Davis Tutt and there are reinactments. There are several places to eat, relax, have a drink around the square and nearby.

data.title: Work walking through but not out of your way
data.text: Nice throwback place, but not too much to read or see.  So, if it's on the way, it's worth stopping, but not really much else..

data.title: Very chill, cool, and architecturally pleasing town hub.
data.text: Best, best place in Springfield MO for a super-great variety of excellent dining and nightlife. Never a dull moment. Hurts donuts so close a +! Love Big Whiskeys, best freakin burgers in town, i can not say enough about Civil Kitchen and Tap, except one of my top 5 in Spfd, and the chicken and donuts a must try at least once w grand marnier syrup :) Black Sheep Burgers a good spot for really great fresh, simpler food and libations, the sweet potato fries a must, must. Izumi Hatake Sushi Bar and Grill a nice touch for sushi off the square same as Nonna's Italian cafe is for Italian. Kid friendly! Visually appealing and cant say enough good.

data.title: Where the First Gunfight Took Place
data.text: Park Central Square was where Wild Bill Hickok shot Dave Tutt in the first recorded "legit" gunfight and where old route 66 passed through Springfield.  In the early 80's, it declined dramatically, but has rebounded with lofts and cafes and shops.  There's even a branch of the city library.  Park Central is home to many Springfield festivals.

data.title: Good, But Off The Square Is Better
data.text: The square used to be a fabulous place back in the '50s and '60s, but has fallen on hard times.  It is trying hard to make a comeback, but still some empty storefronts and just not a lot going on there.  If you go just south, along South St, there are all kinds of restaurants, pubs, small shops and college hangouts.  That area is MUCH more fun than the square itself.
